results.title: Rarotonga
results.brief_description: A look at the people and places of Rarotonga, the biggest island in the Cook Islands. No narration.

results.title: Rarg (K)
results.creator_credit: Tony Collingwood, Christopher O'Hare and Tony Collingwood Productions
results.brief_description: This is the true story of Rarg, a land so perfect that the sun never rose until it was absolutely sure everyone was awake. Everybody in Rarg was happy, until, one day, they discovered they were just a dream in the mind of a man called Edwin Barnes. To save the land of Rarg, they must stop Edwin Barnes waking up. Written by Tony Collingwood. Cast includes Nigel Hawthorne as the storyteller.

results.title: Rapunzel in suburbia
results.brief_description: This film offers a unique opportunity to discover the personality and style of one of Australia’s most prominent authors. Dorothy Hewitt thoroughly engages her audience with stories of her life, comments on her philosophy and discussion of her major works.
results.description: This film offers a unique opportunity to discover the personality and style of one of Australia’s most prominent authors. Dorothy Hewitt thoroughly engages her audience with stories of her life, comments on her philosophy and discussion of her major works.

results.title: Rapid transit
results.brief_description: Forms of rapid transit are vital links in a balanced transportation system. The variety of existing systems in use in the United States and in Toronto, Canada, are shown and the film then goes on to forecast the forms of the new rapid transit facilities soon to become available for use in big cities.

results.title: Range sheep
results.brief_description: Shows the feeding of orphan lambs from bottles, and the shearing, marking, counting, and pasturing of sheep in the summer. Points out that some fo the sheep are marketed in the fall, while the rest of the flock is cared for in the winter.

results.title: Random events
results.creator_credit: John Friedman, Kevin Smith, Educational Services and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description: Patterson Hume and Donald Ivey demonstrate how the overall effect of a large number of random events can be predicted statistically, and apply the results to the predicability of radioactive decay.

results.title: Ranchero and gauchos in Argentina
results.brief_description: Describes life on a cattle ranch near Buenos Aires. Shows gauchos working with the herd and the use of scientific farming methods. Contrasts the lives of the wealthy rancher and his employees. No other credits available.
results.description: Describes life on a cattle ranch near Buenos Aires. Shows gauchos working with the herd and the use of scientific farming methods. Contrasts the lives of the wealthy rancher and his employees. No other credits available.

results.title: Rainshower
results.creator_credit: Michael Murphy, Edward Schuman and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: Presents without commentary the sights, sounds beauty and rhythm of rain. Shows how a rainshower affects the plants and animals on a farm, as well as the people in a community.

results.title: Rainmaking
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Alexander, S.T. Evans and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Making clouds rain has been the subject of intensive research in several countries since the mid-40’s. This study is the story of rainmaking in Australia - from the first tentative experiments with dry ice to the present, large-scale operations using silver iodide as the seeding agent. The film gives an account of the basic theory of cloud-seeding and outlines the techniques used in its practical application. Contains good aerial footage and use of instructional maps to describe cloud formation and rainfall.
